FuncDef: The display arp limit command displays the maximum number of ARP entries that an interface can learn and the corresponding alarm threshold. The display arp limit command displays the maximum number of ARP entries that an interface can learn and the corresponding alarm threshold.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a VLAN.
For the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ:The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 4094.
For the CE6885-LL (low latency mode):The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 1023.

ExtraInfo: If the number of ARP entries that the device learns has reached the upper limit, it will cause some users unable to use the network normally, you can run this command to view the maximum number of ARP entries that each interface can learn and the number of ARP entries that each interface has learned.
